title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, were charged after being arrested in Lewiston, Maine for the killing of Mike Jonas.
Thompson faces a first-degree murder charge and is held without bail; Slade is charged as an accessory and held with $250,000 bail.
The fatal shooting occurred on Sept. 23, 2025, in Finnegan Park, Brockton, where Jonas was shot and killed during an altercation.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels' shortstop Zach Neto but could not meet Los Angeles' high demands.
Zach Neto, 25, has posted consecutive 20-20 seasons and would have been a significant addition to the Red Sox.
Boston solidified its infield by acquiring Caleb Durbin, a third-place NL Rookie of the Year finisher, from the Brewers.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to one day in jail for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa admitted to paying over $20,000 in bribes for issuing 100-300 fraudulent driver's licenses.
Prosecutors cited Cardosa's health issues from a 2022 assault as reason for reduced sentence.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have separated, as they unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Super Bowl.
The New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX.
Diggs faces charges of felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault, with an arraignment scheduled for February 13.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora expressed pride seeing Bad Bunny perform entirely in Spanish at Super Bowl LX halftime.
Cora praised Bad Bunny's celebration of Puerto Rican culture, drawing parallels to his own pride in his heritage.
Despite controversy, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell supported Bad Bunny as a unifying performer for the Super Bowl.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage from the police response to Brown University shooting in December.
The footage, showing an active shooter scene, was redacted to protect victims' privacy; investigation is closed, officials stated.
Shooter Claudio Neves Valente killed three people, injured nine, and was later found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, San Francisco 49ers defensive lineman, underwent surgery after being shot in the ankle in San Francisco.
The shooting took place following a verbal altercation between groups in a business, with no arrests reported.
This incident marks the second 49ers player shooting within 18 months; Ricky Pearsall was shot in August 2024.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum, recovering from an Achilles tear, will practice with the Maine Celtics as he nears a potential return.
Tatum has been engaged in 5-on-5 scrimmages and will continue rehab in Boston after practicing with the Maine Celtics.
Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference with a 34-19 record as Tatum contemplates returning this season.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers were rescued from Camel's Hump mountain in Duxbury, Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures.
A 21-year-old man called 911 on February 7 after the pair faced hypothermia near the summit.
Rescuers reached the hikers at 11:20 p.m.; the woman was hospitalized, both are expected to fully recover.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots focus on strengthening offensive line after Super Bowl loss with potential draft and trade upgrades.
Team seeks another dynamic target for QB Drake Maye, considering options like A.J. Brown and Alec Pierce.
Patriots aim to retain key free agent Christian Gonzalez and evaluate roster decisions to maintain cap flexibility.
